snippet.title: Live NRL 2017 scores: Newcastle Knights v New Zealand Warriors, Gold Coast Titans v Brisbane Broncos, Cronulla Sharks v Canberra Raiders
snippet.content:
Brock Lamb pokes his nose through the defence some 25 metres out and passes to Lachlan Fitzgibbon. It looked about as forward as the previous Warriors pass that was called back. Four tries this year for Fitzgibbon. Trent Hodkinson from 19 metres in from touch. He misses. Newcastle 20-4.
Fitzgibbon in space, the extend their lead! 20-4 with 20 minutes to go.
David Fusitua is over again but it's called back for a forward pass from Roger Tuivasa-Sheck. It looks to have been a very harsh call. Play on if you ask #stupidsaturday Meanwhile there are reports of a back fracture for Nathan Ross. Newcastle 16-4.
All the best
Knights fullback Nathan Ross is down after copping a knock to the nerve. He's in extreme pain and surely must go off. Trainer Tony Ayoub is doing his best to comfort the Ross Dog. He doesn't look like he'll be back today. Newcastle 16-4.
49' Ouch. Break in play as Nathan Ross is down after an accidental knee in the back
Second half underway now. Warriors with first use of the ball, running towards the south. Newcastle 16-4.
It's time for the 2nd Half!
TWO Mitch Barnett tries have helped Newcastle to a commanding halftime lead over the Warriors, whom they appear to be slowly wearing down at McDonald Jones Stadium.
Lock Mitch Barnett scored two tries in the opening 10 minutes to set up a 10-0 lead, with winger David Fusitua pegging them back slightly before two Trent Hodkinson penalty goals just short of the break widened the margin. A win would be the Knights' third of the year. COMMENT: Last week's win over St George Illawarra may prove to be a belated turning point for the Novocastrian.
Hear from Dane Gagai at HT of .
Knights up after the first 40 in Newcastle ðŸ“¸
And another goal from Hodkinson from not too far out. The Knights edge a little further ahead. Death by a thousand cuts for the Warriors. Newcastle 16-4. Newcastle pressuring the Warriors line and the Aucklanders are just holding on. Another penalty for delaying tactics in the ruck. Hodkinson with the goal shot from just to the left of the posts Newcastle 14-4.
32 | Action-packed set there! We get possession, credit to Daniel Saifiti for the chase on Tuivasa-Sheck ...
And the Warriors finally bother the scoreboard attendant; nice little pass from Mason Lino and winger David Fusitua crosses just inside the right cornerpost. Nine tries for David Fusitua. Newcastle 12-4. Through the hands ðŸ™Œ The hit back through Fusitua! 12-4 after 27 minutes.
And Barnett gets a double despite being absolutely surrounded by defenders. He steps off one foot and bustles his way over; the on-field officials said 'no try' but it was over-ruled by the Bunker. Hodkinson adds the conversion. Newcastle 12-0.
Vision of the Try Decision in the 10th minute of .
Nathan Ross makes an incisive run for Newcastle Brock Lamb with the try assist to lock Mitch Barnet who flops behind the posts. An easy conversion for halfback Trent Hodkinson and the home team is off the mark. Newcastle 6-0.
Lamb to Barnett, the are in early! 6-0 after 7 minutes.
And Ken Sio knocks on from the kick-off! The Warriors on the attack. Newcastle 0 Warriors 0.
Super Saturday is underway!
Hear from coach, Nathan Brown in the lead up to .
Hear from Brock Lamb and Roger Tuivasa-Sheck in the lead up to .
NEWCASTLE: Nathan Ross; Ken Sio, Dane Gagai, Peter Matautia, Shaun Kenny-Dowall; Brock Lamb, Trent Hodkinson; Mitch Barnett, Lachlan Fitzgibbon, Sione Matatia (c), Josh King, Jamie Buhrer (c), Daniel Saifiti. Res: Danny Levi, Luke Yates, Jacob Saifiti, Sam Stone.
WARRIORS: Roger Tuivasa-Sheck (c); David Fusitua, Blake Ayshford, Solomone Kata, Ken Maimalo; Kieran Foran, Mason Lino; Jazz Tevaga, Bunty Afoa, Isaiah Papali'i, Sam Lisone, Issac Luke, Jacob Lillyman. Res: Ben Matulino, James Bell, Isaiah Papali'a, Nathaniel Roche.
Referee: Chris Sutton/Chris James.
Greetings from The Other Bunker! Superb day outside in Pyrmont. Three games today starting with Newcastle Warriors, into Gold Coast-Brisbane and finishing up with Cronulla-Canberra. Here's the most recent episode of the podcast - there's an absolutely bumper episode 95 in the works right now.
